            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_39" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is meant by Dollar Cost Averaging?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Dollar Cost Averaging refers to the buying of securities at scheduled intervals, irrespective of the dollar amount, whether the stock price is rising or falling. When the share price is low, more shares can be bought and vice versa. At such, the average cost will be less than the average of the price paid. The risk arising from short-term market fluctuations will be reduced as a result.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How does SMIP work?</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The Cut-off Date of SMIP is on the 7th calendar date of each month (23:59 HK time) including Saturday, Sunday or a Hong Kong public holiday. Customers should submit their instruction to setup a new SMIP, amend or terminate an existing SMIP on or before the Cut-off Date of each month.</li> 
 <li>Customers should ensure their designated cash account has sufficient available funds to cover the gross monthly investment contribution of their existing SMIP from the first business day after the Cut-off Date until 2 business days after the stock is purchased.</li> 
 <li>On the second business day after the Cut-off Date, HSBC will confirm whether customers’ designated cash account has sufficient funds before arranging the purchasing order to buy the stocks.</li> 
 <li>On the third trading day after the Cut-off Date (Transaction Date), HSBC will purchase stocks on behalf of all SMIP customers at the prevailing market price.</li> 
 <li>On the second business day after Transaction Date (Settlement Date), the actual settlement amount of stocks purchased will be debited from customers’ designated cash account and the average purchase price for all stock purchases will be used as the settlement price as well as to calculate fees and charges</li> 
 <li>Purchased stocks will be deposited into customers’ investment services or securities account on the settlement date (i.e. the second business day after the Transaction Date)</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I had terminated a SMIP for the stock “ABC” previously, I start a new SMIP to subscribe the same stock now. Can you consolidate the average purchase price of this stock in these 2 SMIP plans (i.e., the old one and the existing one together)?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. We calculate the average purchase price of a stock purchased in the same plan (under the same reference number) only.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can find your plan reference number is on the SMIP contract note and on the Online Banking – Stock Monthly Investment Plan Page, by logging on to “Online Banking” > “Stock Monthly Investment Plan”.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I have a previously terminated SMIP, how does this affect the calculation of my SMIP stocks?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We calculate the average purchase price of a stock purchased in the same plan (under the same reference number) only and each SMIP plan will have a different plan reference number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This average purchase price, as well as your plan reference number, can be found by logging on to “Online Banking” > “Stock Monthly Investment Plan”.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is there a minimum investment period?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is no minimum investment period. Your chosen stocks will be purchased and deposited into your securities account on a monthly basis, after settlement of which you can sell the shares anytime to capture the profit or meet emergency needs. You also have the flexibility to suspend or stop your contribution as needed.<br> However, you are recommended to treat it as a medium-to long-term investment as you will be able to enjoy higher growth potential of the stocks over time without having to worry about any short-term market fluctuations.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is there any minimum transaction amount for setting up or amending or cancelling SMIP?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The minimum amount for setting up or amending a SMIP is HKD1,000.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I set up a Stocks Monthly Investment Plan with HSBC?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Apply now at HSBC Online Banking, or Simply visit any HSBC branch in Hong Kong to set up the Stocks Monthly Investment Plan.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I amend my SMIP?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may (a) apply to amend online or (b) apply in person at any one of our branches in Hong Kong or (c) apply to amend through our phonebanking service .<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you choose to apply to amend online, please logon to HSBC Online Banking, you may (1) click "My investment" ; (2) click "Order Status" ; (3) click "Stocks Monthly Investment Plan"; (4) choose an existing SMIP that needs to be amended ; (5) click "Modify"; (6) read and accept the Important notes and Terms and Conditions and (7) submit the online application form, and we will follow up with your Instruction accordingly.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I terminate my SMIP?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may (a) apply to amend online or (b) apply in person at any one of our branches in Hong Kong or (c) apply to amend through our phonebanking service .<br> If you choose to apply to amend online, please logon to HSBC Online Banking, you may (1) click "My investment" ; (2) click "Order Status" ; (3) click "Stocks Monthly Investment Plan"; (4) choose an existing SMIP that needs to be amended ; (5) click "Modify"; (6) read and accept the Important notes and Terms and Conditions and (7) submit the online application form, and we will follow up with your Instruction accordingly.</p>
</div></div>

<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_13">
    </h3><h3><strong>What are unit trusts? How can I benefit from unit trusts investment?</strong></h3>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_40" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unit trusts (or mutual funds) give investors the opportunity to diversify even a small investment in securities, bonds, currencies and commodities in markets around the world. This is achieved by combining the resources of many investors into one large fund which can be spread over a number of different investments and over a wide geographical area. This range of investments is called a portfolio.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unit trusts have a number of benefits:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Spreading the risk. You spread your investment across a diverse portfolio. This is usually safer than investing in a single share. Of course, levels of risk and return also vary among different funds.</li> 
 <li>Professional management. Fund managers spend their working lives researching and managing investments. It would be very difficult for an individual to have an in-depth knowledge of markets around the world. With a unit trust, their expertise is working for you.</li> 
 <li>Access to worldwide markets. Your money can be invested in overseas markets, which may not be easily accessible by individuals.</li> 
 <li>Economies of scale. With a large number of investors contributing to a single fund, operating costs and commissions can be amortised. Individual investors thus pay lower fees.</li> 
 <li>Liquidity. You can buy and sell unit trusts on any dealing day (except on public holidays in the countries/regions to which your fund is linked). Your money need not be tied up for a specific period of time.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Some unit trust products are linked to the index options listed on the various stock exchanges or sometimes to currency options. They can be slightly riskier than more diverse funds.</p>
</div></div>

            <h3 id="1576184940__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Unit Trusts FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1576184940__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_25">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_26" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_41" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are they very expensive?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can start up a unit trust for the price of a dinner for two, and you can make a monthly minimum contribution of as little as HKD1,000.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I get easy access to my investment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unit trusts are very flexible and you can buy and sell unit trusts on any (dealing) day. Your proceeds can take as little as seven working days to access.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I have to make a lump sum investment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You don't need to make a large lump sum investment. We can also offer you a monthly investment plan where no initial lump sum is required and the monthly contribution is as low as HKD1,000.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are they high risk?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unit trusts obviously have an element of risk but less so than direct investment on the stock market. Risk is comparatively lower because it may be spread over a number of years, a variety of commodities, currencies or countries - you are spreading the risk.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are the returns low?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Because unit trusts are comparatively low-risk investment, they therefore can offer lower rates of return in comparison to high-risk direct investments.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are they difficult to monitor?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Professional fund managers do this for you, so you don't have to monitor them on a daily basis. They have access to information and research statistics from economists and analysts around the world, and keep you updated of major changes.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are the commission fees high?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unit trust fees are actually much lower than if you were to set up an individual fund or investment. This is due to economies of scale. As a large number of investors are involved in a fund the fee cost is therefore shared and thus reduced.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the different types of Unit Trusts available through HSBC?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC offers wide range of unit trusts under 3 major asset categories, namely Equity funds, Balanced or Multi-assets funds and Fixed Income funds. Individual funds investing in different regions, has different investment strategies and investment objectives to better serve our customer's wealth needs against his/her risk appetite.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are unit trusts investment similar to a pension plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Broadly speaking, unit trusts serve as one of the major investment tools to fulfill customer's retirement needs and planning currently. It also serves to cater customer's education needs, for wealth accumulation and other wealth needs.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the key charges in Unit Trusts? How can I access to these fees details and understand the potential risks involved?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The relevant fees and charges of individual unit trusts may vary, including but not limited to Initial Charge and Annual Management Fee. Please refer the detailed fees and charges from the respective offering documents.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the risks in investing in Unit Trusts?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In general, investors are exposed to following risks in investing in unit trusts and investors should refer to the individual product offering document for further details and risks involved.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Investment Risk - Unit Trusts are NOT equivalent to time deposits. They are investment products and some may involve derivatives. Investment involves risks. Past performance is no guide to future performance of the funds. Value of the investments can fluctuate and is not guaranteed.</li> 
 <li>Credit risk - For funds investing in bonds, bonds are subject to the risk of the issuer defaulting on its obligations. It should also be noted that credit ratings assigned by credit rating agencies do not guarantee the creditworthiness of the issuer</li> 
 <li>Liquidity risk - There is a risk that investments made by a unit trust may become less liquid in response to unfavourable market developments or market sentiment</li> 
 <li>Currency risk - If the fund's assets and income are denominated in currencies other than the base currency of the fund, currency movement may affect the value of the fund's share price.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I subscribe or redeem unit trusts through my HSBC account?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can place your subscription and redemption orders via HSBC Internet Banking. If you already have an HSBC Investment Services/Securities account, you can simply log on and execute your orders with us. We also offer Unit Trusts Investment Services through our branches. To open an Investment Services/Securities account, simply visit www.hsbc.com.hk any time or visit any HSBC branch in Hong Kong.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will the bank provide me with regular statements of my unit trusts investment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, HSBC will provide contract note of relevant transactions and you can also find your unit trusts holding record in the monthly consolidated statement (if applicable).</p>
</div></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            ESG Investing FAQs
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    


<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_14">
    </h3><h3><strong>What does 'ESG' stand for?  </strong></h3>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_42" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ESG stands for Environmental, Social and Governance. ESG and sustainability factors influence a wide range of industries from agricultural, industrial, consumption, technology to medical sectors as these factors are closely connected to social policies, economic development and individual lives.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_14" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_13" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-2087457853__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h4 id="-2087457853__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other ESG Investing FAQs </h4>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-2087457853__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_27">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_28" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_43" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is ESG investing? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ESG investing, also referred to as sustainable investing, refers to specific investment approaches that aim to generate long-term financial returns while advancing sustainable solutions and outcomes. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why does investing in ESGs matter?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ESG provides a measure for investors to use to seek and screen the sustainability of investment opportunities arising from the global response to climate change.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As ESG is gaining traction, it's likely to become an important factor for corporate performances, driven by market demand. Investment portfolios may become more resilient and contribute to society as a whole through the inclusion of ESG. Investors should also note that ESG solutions do not guarantee returns on their portfolios.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does ESG investment provide or guarantee better performance?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ESG investment maintains a focus on financial returns, alongside environmental and social considerations. Based on our analysis, adopting an ESG approach in investment has benefited stock and bond portfolio performance over the last 10 years. Also, risk-adjusted returns in the long-term are likely to be structurally stronger as the economy transitions to sustainability. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">However, ESG investment does not guarantee or necessarily provide better performance than their peers. ESG factors don't necessarily hurt investment performance, and sustainable investment may in fact help future-proof investment portfolios against the risks associated with a transition to a more sustainable economy.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note past performance does not indicate future returns.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What products are under the ESG umbrella?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC offers a comprehensive range of sustainable investment products to help clients align their sustainability objectives and financial goals. These include green, social and sustainability bonds, sustainability-linked bonds, investment funds, structured products and green certificates of deposit. <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I find ESG funds?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Access our list of ESG funds by selecting the ESG search checkbox on the unit trust search tool via HSBC Online and Mobile Banking. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I find ESG bonds?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can explore our list of ESG (Green) bonds by visiting our <a href="https://investments3.personal-banking.hsbc.com.hk/public/BOND/index.html?LANGTAG=EN" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Bond Screener page</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Bond Screener page  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and selecting 'ESG (Green) bonds'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Or if you're on the HSBC home page, simply go to 'Investing' and select 'Bonds/CDs'. Next, choose 'View our available bonds/CDs' and select the 'ESG (Green) bonds' tile.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How will investment products be assessed as 'sustainable investments' at HSBC?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">At HSBC, we classify sustainable investments as either ESG-enhanced, Impact and Thematic. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ESG-enhanced refers to the approach of investing in companies based on relative ESG performance, which covers a spectrum of approaches such as ESG tilting or positive screening, to intentionally invest in companies based on relative ESG performance or momentum; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Thematic focuses on themes and sectors dedicated to resolving climate and sustainability challenges that covers strategies that focus on ESG related growth areas and trends, by seeking out companies or sectors that align with specific sustainable outcomes; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Impact focuses on a direct, positive and measurable impact on society and/or the environment, which covers strategies that aim to deliver intentional, direct and positive environmental and or social impact. Such investment opportunities deliver both financial returns alongside environmental and social returns.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kind of investment products could be classified as "sustainable investment" at HSBC?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC assesses different investment product types, including funds, bonds and structured products, to determine whether an investment product could be considered as 'sustainable investment' under the bank's definition framework.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does HSBC’s sustainable investing classification apply to other banks?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No it doesn't. Please note that the categorisation of investment products under the sustainable investing definition framework at HSBC may not apply to other institutions.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I hold a similar product at another institution but its sustainable investment classification is different than that of HSBC. Why is it the case?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Different organisations may employ various methodologies on classifying sustainable investments. HSBC adopts a strict product assessment and classify products according to the framework established (ESG Enhanced, Thematic and Impact) to define what we consider to be ‘sustainable investing’.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ESG / sustainable investing is an evolving area and new regulations may come into effect which may affect how an investment is categorised or labelled. An investment which is considered to fulfil sustainable criteria today may not meet those criteria at some point in the future. We will review and update the eligible investment product list from time to time.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How frequently are investment products reviewed to ensure that they are considered as "sustainable investing" according to HSBC?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We endeavour to update the eligible investment products under our definition and classification of sustainable investing as timely as possible. The list of products categorised as 'ESG Enhanced', 'Thematic' and 'Impact' are reviewed and updated periodically.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I find ESG Enhanced, Thematic and Impact products in "My Holdings" when I logged on to HSBC Personal Internet Banking?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For unit trusts, stocks, bonds and certificates of deposit, they can be identified by the ESG label with the HSBC Sustainable Investment categories under ESG analysis and My Holdings via HSBC Personal Internet Banking:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>log on to HSBC Personal Internet Banking</li> 
 <li>view details of the ESG analysis under My portfolio</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Structured Products
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    


<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_15">
    </h3><h3><strong>What are Structured Products? And how do they work? </strong></h3>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_44" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Structured Products are investment instruments embedded with derivatives, under which the return, the amount due and/or the method of settlement is determined by reference to 1) changes in the price, value and/or level of one or more reference underlying assets; and/or 2) the occurrence or non-occurrence of an event.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_15" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_14" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1551729296__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-1551729296__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Structured Products FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1551729296__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_29">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_30" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_45" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I benefit from investing in Structured Products?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Customer can benefit from investing in Structured Products:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Return - by participating in the performance of various underlying assets to achieve a higher potential return in some market situation.<br> </li> 
 <li>Capital Protection - some types of Structured Products offer investors principal protection at maturity.</li> 
 <li>Callable - some Structured Products come with auto-callable or callable feature, which enable the investors to receive their investment capital earlier than maturity.</li> 
 <li>Portfolio diversification - allowing diversification through participation in the performance of different assets or markets.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is Pre-Investment Cooling-off Period?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Effective from 1 January 2011, a Pre-Investment Cooling Off Period arrangement is required by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) for non-listed derivative product purchases to enhance investor protection to ensure that customers have sufficient time to consider the non-listed derivative product purchase.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Pre-Investment Cooling-off Period (PICOP) is applicable to each particular dealing of the Structured Products if investor is one of the following retail customer types who place order via branch:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(1) An elderly customer aged 65 or above, unless investor is not a first-time buyer of that particular type of structured products AND investor's asset concentration<sup>^</sup> is below 20% AND investor opts out from the PICOP arrangement; or<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(2) A non-elderly investor who is a first time buyer of that particular type of structured products AND investor's asset concentration is 20% or above.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If Pre-Investment Cooling-off Period is applicable to investor, investor can only subscribe for the product at least 2 calendar days (of which the last day should be a business day) after product discussion with the Bank. This is to ensure that investor have sufficient time to understand the product and consider the appropriateness of the investment before deciding on the subscription.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><sup>^</sup> For the purpose of determining whether PICOP is applicable, asset concentration refers to the percentage of total net worth (excluding real estate properties) to be invested in this product.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is Post-Sale Cooling-off Period?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the investment period of the Equity Linked Investment customers subscribe is more than one year, customer can cancel or unwind (as the case may be) the whole of the Equity Linked Investment purchase order during the period from (and including) the date customers place the purchase order to (and including) the fifth Hong Kong business day after the order date (this period is referred to as the post-sales cooling-off period), and get back the issue price minus any negative market value adjustment. Please refer to the Product Booklet for details. The Bank does not apply any handling charge on such cancel or unwind order. If customers choose to cancel or unwind the Equity Linked Investment purchase order during the post-sales cooling off period, please contact our branch between 10:00am and 12:00 noon on any Hong Kong business day during the post-sales cooling-off period. Our staff will help you complete the sell order form.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the different types of Structured Products available through HSBC?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Structured Products linked to various underlying including equity, Exchanged Traded Fund (ETF), foreign exchange (FX), and interest rates are offered in HSBC.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will the bank provide me any confirmation advice/ contract note of my investment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Advice will be provided to customers upon deposit placement & maturity for Deposit Plus, Capital Protected Investment Deposits, and Equity Linked Investments.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the risks in investing in Structured Products?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In general, investors are exposed to following risks in investing in Structured Products and investors should refer to the individual product offering document for further details and risks involved.</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Not equivalent to a time deposit - Structured products are embedded with derivatives and are not equivalent to time deposits.<br> </li> 
 <li>Maximum potential loss - For non capital protected structured products, the downside risk may be unlimited, and you could lose all of the investment in extreme cases.</li> 
 <li>Market risk - You will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset, which will affect the payout under the structured product.</li> 
 <li>Liquidity risk - Some structured products do not offer redemption feature and you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire tenor of the product. For products with redemption feature, you may sell the product before maturity but you may suffer a potential loss of principal irrespective of the asset price performance.</li> 
 <li>Credit risk / Default Risk of Issuer - If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer. In the worst scenario, you could lose all of your investment.</li> 
 <li>Currency risk - If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the different fees & charges for Structured Products?<br> </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In general, there are no additional charges on investing Structured Products, all operational, administrative and hedging costs, etc have already been contained and subsumed within the calculation of the return and/or other variables of the Product.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(For HK stocks only) If customer elects for physical settlement for Equity Linked Investment, customer will need to pay for related deposit transaction charge plus stamp duty for the underlying assets being deposited to your investment account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><span style="font-family: "HSBC Univers Next Regular", Arial, "PingFang SC", "Microsoft YaHei", "Lantinghei SC", "Heiti SC", simhei, sans-serif; font-size: 1rem; font-variant-ligatures: inherit; font-variant-caps: inherit; background-color: transparent;"><strong>Can I sell the Structured Products before it matures? Is there a penalty to unwind early?</strong></span></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Customers can early sell back Equity Linked Investments and Interest Rate Linked Capital Protected Investment Deposit subject to individual product offering documents. The early sell back price will be subject to prevailing market conditions and may be less than the principal amount of the original investment.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any specific eligibility requirements for subscribing ELIs linked to US stock(s)?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you are required to hold a valid W-8BEN Form record before subscribing for ELIs linked to US stock(s). If needed, you may submit a Substitute Form W-8BEN through HSBC Online Banking, HSBC HK Easy Invest app or visiting any HSBC branches in Hong Kong. Apart from that, you will have to conduct a suitability assessment with reference to your personal circumstances during the subscription process.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What stock markets do your ELIs cover?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Our equity linked investment services include both Hong Kong and US securities as the underlying choices.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I create a DCDC ELI product with both HK and US stocks in the same basket?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you can create your own ELI product with a basket of HK stocks OR US stocks, however HK stocks and US stocks cannot be put into the same basket when building one ELI product.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When can I create my own ELI product through HSBC Online Banking?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can build your own ELI product linked to HK Stock(s) through HSBC Online Banking from 9:30 am to 3:10 pm on trading days from Monday through Friday (Hong Kong Time) (“HKT”) (excluding Hong Kong public holidays, half-day trading, or market disruption days).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">While for ELI product linked to US Stock(s),  you can create it from 9:30 am to 5:30 pm (HKT) on trading day from Monday to Friday (except for Hong Kong and United States public holidays, half-day trading, or market disruption day).</p>
</div></div>

<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_16">
    </h3><h3><strong>How is the Integrated Account Secured Credit Facility Loan Ratio calculated when the Deposit Plus deposit date is 2 business days after the application submission?</strong></h3>

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_46" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After the Deposit Plus order placement on trade date and before deposit date:<br>
</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
<li>For order with deposit currency in foreign currency (FCY), the order 'hold amount' will be deducted from the account available balance and thus will not be included in the Credit limit of Secured Credit Facility calculation. The Credit limit of Secured Credit Facility will drop during the period accordingly since FCY deposit has been included in the Credit limit of Secured Credit Facility calculation before trade date.</li>
<li>For order with deposit currency in HKD, the order 'hold amount' will also be deducted from the account available balance and will not be included in the Credit limit of Secured Credit Facility calculation. Yet, the Credit limit of Secured Credit Facility will not be affected during the period since HKD deposit has not been included in the Credit limit of Secured Credit Facility calculation before trade date.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">On DPS deposit date, i.e. on trade date + 2 business days,</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Order amount in any deposit currency will be included in the calculation of Credit limit of Secured Credit Facility until it is uplifted on maturity date.</p>

<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_17">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_47" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">

<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have a target exchange rate in mind, you can use our FX Order Watch Trading Service to preset your instruction.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you want to accumulate your foreign currencies or RMB via regular saving, you can use the ForEx / RMB Switching Service to preset your exchange instructions and we will automatically execute the instructions for you according to your preset criteria.</p>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is FX Order Watch Trading Services?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">FX Order Watch Trading Services is available to HSBC Premier and HSBC One customers only. Customers can pre-set their own target FX rate using Internet Banking or Mobile Banking to convert funds automatically within accounts for the foreign exchange when the FX rate is hit. It also provides an alert service which customers will be informed via SMS/email when the FX rate is hit.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What can I use FX for?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Customers can use HSBC's foreign exchange services for many purposes which include but not limit to the followings :</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Meet your "wealth accumulation" needs, e.g. pre-set instruction using RMB switching service to accumulate RMB at your own pace.</li> 
 <li>Meet your "family" needs, e.g. use FX Order Watch and alert service to pre-set instruction to convert funds to other currenices at your preferred rate to settle oversea payment like mortgage or tuition fee for your children.</li> 
 <li>Meet your "Lifestyle needs", e.g. use pre-order foreign currencies services when you plan to travel to overseas so as to save your queuing time for currency exchange at branch.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the regulatory restrictions related to FX?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are no Hong Kong regulatory restrictions on general foreign exchange.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who can transact in FX?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">All customers who have valid foreign currency account can transact in FX.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What platforms are available for me to deal in FX?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Following major service platforms are available for HSBC customers to conduct FX transactions :</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>FX Order Watch Trading Service</li> 
 <li>FX / RMB Switching Service</li> 
 <li>24-hour online foreign exchange service</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please refer to the Foreign Exchange section in our website for more details of each service.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the risks associated with FX products?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">When conducting in foreign exchange, customers need to be aware of the following risks.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Currency conversion risk - the value of your foreign currency and RMB deposit will be subject to the risk of exchange rate fluctuation. If you choose to convert your foreign currency and RMB deposit to other currencies at an exchange rate that is less favourable than the exchange rate in which you made your original conversion to that foreign currency and RMB, you may suffer loss in principal.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Being a customer, will I get access to latest FX update and houseviews?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC customers are provided with timely and comprehensive FX information from our FX specialist. Please refer to Foreign Exchange Market News section in our website and you will find the latest FX market information, including trend chart, technical analysis and comments from our FX specialist for most major currencies.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the various FX services that Bank offers me?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC offers a comprehensive foreign exchange services to customers which include :</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>24-Hour Foreign Exchange Service</li> 
 <li>Pre-order Foreign Currency Service</li> 
 <li>ForEx/Renminbi Switching Services</li> 
 <li>FX Order Watch Trading Services</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please refer to Foreign Exchange section in our website for more details<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is the real-time currency exchange service 24/7?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. The real-time currency exchange service is available 24/7 via HSBC Online and Mobile Banking for all-in-one integrated accounts and HKD Passbook Savings account except during system <a title=" " href="/legal/maintenance-schedule/"></a><a id="#regular-schedule"></a><a href="/legal/maintenance-schedule/#regular-schedule">maintenance hours</a> and special circumstances.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For USD/CombiNation Passbook Savings account, service hours are from Monday to Friday 8:00am to 7:00pm and Saturday 8:00am to 4:30pm HKT, except on:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Hong Kong public holidays</li> 
 <li>12:00am to 7:59am HKT on 26 December and 2 January</li> 
 <li>when a Black Rainstorm Warning Signal or Typhoon No. 8 signal or above is hoisted</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The real-time currency exchange service via phone banking is only available from Monday 5:00am to Saturday 4.59am and Saturday 8:00 am to 4.30 pm HKT, except on:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>25 December and 1 January (whole day)</li> 
 <li>12:00am to 7:59am HKT on 26 December and 2 January</li> 
 <li>when a Black Rainstorm Warning Signal or Typhoon No. 8 signal or above is hoisted</li> 
</ul>

<h3 class="heading A-TYP16R-RW-ALL " id="content_main_heading_18">

</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_49" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">IPO stands for Initial Public Offering. It is the first time a company issues securities/bonds to investors. The newly issued securities/bonds may be listed on a stock exchange.</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>

        <section id="-1776376852__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_34">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_50" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I deposit my share certificate(s)?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you need to deposit your share certificate(s), please visit any of the following 10 branches:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Hong Kong Office</li> 
 <li>Exchange Square Branch</li> 
 <li>Hopewell Centre Branch</li> 
 <li>North Point Branch</li> 
 <li>Mong Kok Branch</li> 
 <li>Tsim Sha Tsui Branch</li> 
 <li>Kwun Tong Branch</li> 
 <li>Yuen Long Branch</li> 
 <li>Tai Po Branch</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please refer to the Branch and Express Banking Locator for contact details of the branches.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the risks associated with IPOs?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Over-subscribing to an IPO</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In some cases, IPOs may be oversubscribed. The company may go through a balloting/allocation process to determine whether an investor will receive any securities and if so, in what quantity. An investor may be tempted to subscribe for a greater quantity than he intended to, believing that he will not receive the full amount in case of over-subscription. However if the IPO is not oversubscribed, the investor will receive all the quantity applied for and will have to pay the full cost.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Market risk</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is a risk that the company's share price will drop below its initial IPO price, once the company's securities/bonds trading (on the stock market or otherwise) commences. Securities/bond/ prices will fluctuate over time.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Company risk</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It is vital to understand the company and the business you are investing in. Thoroughly study the prospectus, financial reports and even seek professional advice before you make investment decisions. For more information on investing, visit our Investment Services.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is HSBC IPO Nominees Services?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It is a service open for HSBC Investment Services/Securities account holders to subscribe for newly listed/issued securities/bonds/certificates of deposits in IPO in HSBC Nominee's name. Customers can click on www.hsbc.com.hk and follow the links to fill in the IPO application form and choose the settlement account from any of their HSBC accounts.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the benefits of applying with HSBC IPO Nominees Services?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC would like to provide you with the greatest convenience. If you choose to apply for securities with HSBC IPO Nominees Services (to do so, you must maintain an Investment Services/Securities account with HSBC), we will help you through with the whole application process, and you may enjoy the following benefits:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Payment Convenience - you can choose to pay the application money from any of your HSBC account and we will directly debit your account, saving much of your time in payment arrangement.</li> 
 <li>Earliest Availability - your allotted securities/bonds/certificates of deposit will be directly credited into your Investment Services/Securities account on the first listing/issue day, which will allow you to take immediate actions according to market conditions.</li> 
 <li>Refund Convenience - any refund of the application money will be directly credited to your payment account.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What amount of funds should I hold in my settlement account after I have submitted an IPO application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">total share cost = price per share * number of shares applied<br> total amount of payment = total share cost + brokerage + handling charge (if any) + SFC transaction levy + FRC transaction levy (effective on 1 Jan 2022)<br> + Stock Exchange trading fee  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The amount of funds you should hold in your settlement account is the total amount of payment rounded up to nearest integer. Please note that the actual settlement amount may be greater than or lower than the amount calculated in the formulas above. The bank may adopt some rounding measures in calculation of Transaction levies, Stamp Duty and HKEx Trading Fee, but will ensure that this never results in our customers paying more than the stated levy. The bank will also ensure that the correct levies will be paid to the relevant regulatory authorities.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to register with HSBC if I apply through HSBC IPO Nominees Services? Is there any service charge or handling fee?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, to apply through HSBC IPO Nominees Services, you need to maintain an Investment Services/ Securities account with the Bank. The securities/bonds/certificates of deposit allotted will be directly deposited into the Investment Services/Securities account with the Bank. Unless otherwise specified, there will be a handling charge of HKD50 for every stock IPO application through HSBC HK Easy Invest app, HSBC HK Mobile Banking app ,or HSBC Personal Internet Banking. The handling charge will be HKD100 if the stock IPO application is through our designated branches or IPO service hotline on (852) 2269 2121. For bond and certificates of deposit IPOs, there will be a handling fee of 0.15% on the subscription amount through HSBC designated branches, IPO service hotline, HSBC Personal Internet Banking. There may also be other charges in respect of individual IPO. Please refer to the details of respective IPO at the eIPO Centre.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I make the application payment for the application? Is there any maximum payment limit applicable?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">With HSBC IPO Nominees Services, you can choose to debit the application money from any of your HSBC savings or current accounts.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is no payment limit as long as you have deposited enough money for the application in your chosen settlement account. However, you should ensure that there are sufficient funds in the account to cover the full subscription cost no later than 12 midnight on the day which is one business day prior to the closing date of the public offer period, otherwise, your IPO application will be cancelled accordingly.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is online IPO application available 24 hours a day?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, it is a round-the-clock service and you can submit your application via HSBC HK Easy Invest app (Stock IPO only), HSBC HK Mobile Banking app (Stock IPO only) ,or HSBC Personal Internet Banking (for Stock IPO) for the particular IPO anytime within the specified HSBC IPO Nominees Services offering period.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I know whether my IPO application has been successfully submitted?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check your application progress on the 'Order status' page via HSBC Online Banking, HSBC HK App or HSBC HK Easy Invest app. If your IPO application is submitted successfully, you'll see the status for your IPO application on the page.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I amend or cancel my stock IPO application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You cannot amend a stock IPO application, but you can cancel a stock IPO and submit a new application before the cut-off time.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can do so via HSBC Online Banking, HSBC HK Mobile Banking App or HSBC HK Easy Invest App before the cut-off time of that stock IPO application. To cancel an applied stock IPO, find the stock IPO application in the 'Order status' page and then select 'Cancel'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I know if my IPO application is successful or not?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your IPO application is successful, newly allotted stocks/ bonds/ certificates of deposit will be credited into your Investment Services/ Securities account on the date of issuance. You can then take immediate action according to market conditions.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How will I be refunded should my application be partially successful or wholly unsuccessful?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For partially successful and wholly unsuccessful applications, the application money (or part thereof) will be credited back directly to your chosen settlement account within the days specified in the respective Prospectus/Offering Memorandum.</p>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_53" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What assets are in scope of the offer of Asset segregation offer? </strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The offer is only made with respect to securities (i.e. bonds, Certificates of Deposit (CDs) and stocks) which are held directly with Euroclear Bank SA/NV, the only European Economic Area Central Securities Depository (CSD) that we are a participant (e.g. with ISIN suffix: XS, US, AU, CA). The offer does not pertain to securities held with other custodians or subcustodians of Euroclear. <br> </p>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_37">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_54" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which option is safer for me? Is there a difference to how my assets are handled?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your assets are well protected in both Individual Client Segregated Account (ISA) and Omnibus Client Segregated Account (OSA).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In both cases of ISA and OSA, HSBC, as a professional custodian, reconciles the books against CSDs regularly so that each client’s assets can be evidenced at all times. <br> <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the difference between ISA or OSA in case of insolvency?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Insolvency proceedings are governed by law in each impacted jurisdiction. As long as they remain the property of the client, the securities do not form part of HSBC estate upon insolvency regardless of whether they were kept in an OSA or ISA.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who are HSBC Branches?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> “Branches” mentioned in the Notice refer to The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited (“HSBC”) ’s branches in Hong Kong and overseas.<br> <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will customer suffer from any shortfall in ISA or OSA?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, customers may suffer from shortfall in either an ISA or an OSA. If there were a shortfall between the number of securities that we are obliged to deliver to clients and the number of securities that we hold on their behalf in either an ISA or an OSA, this could result in fewer securities (of the type where a shortfall has arisen) than clients are entitled to being returned to them. If securities were held in an ISA, the entire shortfall would be borne by the client for whom the relevant account was held. If securities were held in an OSA, the shortfall would be allocated between the clients with an interest in that account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the costs involved in opening an ISA?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is a one-off account set up fee: USD200; and annual account service fee: USD12,000. The cost of an ISA is much higher than an OSA due to increased operational effort, additional complexity and expenditures at both HSBC and the CSD.<br> <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I have to do anything? Is there any deadline to change the segregation level?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please read the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/investments/bonds/notice.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Notice</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Notice  This link will open in a new window</span></a> to clients about the offer and related disclosure on the website. No action is required if you do not wish to change your account setup and there is no fee change for clients who remain under the OSA structure. Only if you wish to move your assets to ISA (or from ISA to OSA) will you need to indicate to us your interest. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can approach us any time should you wish to change the segregation level applicable to your assets held in Euroclear Bank SA/NV. You are invited to contact your RM or alternatively call <a href="tel:85222333033" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3033</a> for HSBC Premier Elite customers, <a href="tel:85222333322" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3322</a> for HSBC Premier customers,  <a href="tel:85222333000" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3000</a> for other personal banking customers.<br>  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What will change as a result of the CSDR Settlement Discipline Regime (SDR) implementation?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The expectation is that securities settlement rates across the EEA will improve. This will be triggered by measures to prevent and monitor settlement fails and further incentivised by cash penalties against market participants causing the settlement fails and in favour of their non-defaulting counterparties. <br>  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does CSDR SDR apply to all instruments our clients may trade?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It applies to all types of instruments as long as:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The transactions in these instruments are intended to settle through an EEA CSD;</li> 
 <li>The instruments are admitted to trading or traded on a EEA trading venue or cleared by a EEA Central Counterparty (CCP);</li> 
 <li>In the case of shares, the primary trading venue of the instruments is located in the EEA. </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What benefits can our clients expect to see from CSDR SDR?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">CSDR, and within it the SDR, will enhance the safety and efficiency of securities settlement in the EEA. The effects of CSDR will be largely transparent to our clients whilst already being protected from settlement delays through contractual arrangements. <br>  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do our clients need to do anything?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In most cases, no action is necessary. Where specific activity or awareness may be needed, our clients will receive communication from us regarding the upcoming changes. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does CSDR SDR mean additional costs for our clients?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In most cases, no additional costs are expected. In circumstances where a settlement delay is caused directly by the actions of the client, HSBC may reserve the right to pass on cash penalties received from or due to the EEA CSDs. If and when action is required, clients will be informed. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What does it mean that the scope of CSDR SDR is extraterritorial?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This simply means the regulation applies to any securities transaction that is eligible to settle in one of the EEA CSDs, regardless of the location of the market participant or the end client entering into the transaction.<br>  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can regulatory information be found on CSDR SDR?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Further details and context can be found here:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="https://www.esma.europa.eu/regulation/post-trading/settlement" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA): Central Securities Depositories Regulation</span><span class="visuallyhidden">European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA): Central Securities Depositories Regulation  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The regulatory content relevant to the Settlement Discipline Regime can be found in:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32014R0909" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">CSDRCSDR Open In New Window: Articles 6-7</span><span class="visuallyhidden">CSDRCSDR Open In New Window: Articles 6-7  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv:OJ.L_.2018.230.01.0001.01.ENG&toc=OJ:L:2018:230:TOC" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">RTS (EU) 2018/1229 on Settlement Discipline (CSDR RTS)</span><span class="visuallyhidden">RTS (EU) 2018/1229 on Settlement Discipline (CSDR RTS)  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv:OJ.L_.2017.065.01.0001.01.ENG&toc=OJ:L:2017:065:TOC" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Delegated Act (EU) 2017/389 on Cash Penalties and Substantial Importance</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Delegated Act (EU) 2017/389 on Cash Penalties and Substantial Importance  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>
</div></div>
